page.title: 01ALDBROUGH ST. JOHN
page.content: {Aldbrough}or{Aldburne}as it is written by the scribes of the{Domesday {Book}is situated 7 miles North of Richmond. At its centre is a large (17 acres) green through which runs a trout stream. Its name also appears as {Aldburghe,}a{Saxon settlement}but no trace now remains of the old burgh or castle. The land formed part of the Richmondshire possessions of the Saxon {Earl Edwin}and the{manor of eight {carucates}(a carucate or oxgang being that amount of land which could be ploughed by a team of 8 oxen) was held by{Tor.}Now its land and properties are in diverse ownership. In 1281,{Edward I}granted by charter to{John, Earl of Richmond}the right to hold a weekly market on Tuesday and a yearly fair on the vigil and morrow of St. Michael - the latter is now known as{Aldbrough Feast.}
